data.title: Ability to select and launch debug configuration
data.body:
Adds 'debug' keyword similar to 'task' and 'git' to command palette.  

Fixes #16613.

data.title: command palette not in schema
data.body: We now have the `commandPalette` as menu id and should therefore have it in the schema and validation.

data.title: VSCode doesn't seem to override html.format.extraLiners config prop
data.body:
I couldn't reopen #4261, so here it is as a new issue: It looks like there's a regression, as if VSCode would no longer respect `html.format.extraLiners` config. - VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0| |jslint|ajhyndman|1.2.1| |Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.11.0| |ck4-test-mate|mlewand|0.0.1| |jsrefactor|cmstead|0.5.3| |jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.6| |copy-relative-path|enochc|0.1.1| |beautify|HookyQR|0.8.4| |copy-markdown-as-html|jerriepelser|1.0.0| |docthis|joelday|0.4.0| |copy-github-url|mattlott|0.1.0| |vscode-exec-node|miramac|0.2.1| |ecdc|mitchdenny|0.10.3| |select-part-of-word|mlewand|0.2.0| |debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.3| |promise-snippets|progre|0.2.3| |vscode-open|sandcastle|0.1.0| |code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.4| |code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.14.6| |selectline-statusbar|tomoki1207|0.0.1| |vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.1| |change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0| |JasmineSnippets|xabikos|0.2.1| |JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0| --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set your `"html.format.extraLiners"` to `"head,body,div,p,/html"`. 1. Open new tab with `ctrl+n`. 1. Switch tab language to HTML. 1. Set a following markup: ```html
foo
foo
foo

foo

foo

foo

``` 1. Press `ctrl+shift+f` to execute `Format Document` command. ## Expected Lines are inserted also after `p` and `div` elements. ```html
foo
foo
foo

foo

foo

foo

``` ## Actual Missing new lines after `div` or `p`. ```html
foo
foo
foo

foo

foo

foo

```

data.title: (ctrl + p) can access to any location we need something like it to create any location as well.
data.body:
Add shortcut on the keyboard to show input box like (ctrl + p) to type location to create any file with any path.

We can make the life easier with this feature. because (ctrl + p) can access to any location we need something like it to create any location as well.

And we can add inside the box auto complete by {TAB key} for exists location to create files to exists directories fast as well.

Thanks for hard work any way.

![aa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17777237/23152801/22d7055e-f80d-11e6-93c7-d3c75cfb7a37.JPG)

data.title: Callback parameter for TestEditorService() is optional
data.body: Since the `callback` property is assigned an empty function in the constructor of TestEditorService, we shouldn't have to pass one in every time.

data.title: Remove dependency on window.event in ListView
data.body:
Fixes Microsoft/monaco-editor#371.

The `event` property of Window is [nonstandard] and isn't supported by Firefox,
breaking some of ListView's event-handling behavior.

I checked for places where VSCode depends on `window.event` by removing it from
`lib.d.ts` and building from scratch; the references in ListView were the only
ones I found in `src/vs/base/browser`. There are also some references in
non-browser parts of the codebase, but I assume that's fine since they work in
Electron.

[nonstandard]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/event

Here is the extension:

Sorry, that I cannot provide more information, but I don't get any errors or hints what possibly could have gone wrong.

data.title: Syntax coloring bug on certain C++ preprocessor constructs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- C/C++ extension version 0.10.1 (_installed, but disabled_)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

### Steps to Reproduce:

See the below screenshot.

![cpptools screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1915951/23144587/88f6f780-f796-11e6-8a46-d083f2c886e8.png)

In the above screenshot, the blue coloring of the preprocessor-macro value "leaks" into the rest of the document. There are two things I can do to avoid this:

1. Change line 13 to say `#define LLD_VERSION_STRING() LLD_MAKE_VERSION_STRING(...)`. The extra parentheses after the macro name cause the blue coloring to terminate at the end of the line.
1. Add a second preprocessor command (`#define`, `#if`, etc) after the line that causes the bug. This also causes the syntax coloring to reset.

I am not sure whether to file this issue here or at [vscode-cpptools](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools). While my issue is C++-related, it still occurs if the C/C++ extension is disabled. (I had to disable it because it was eating up way too much RAM for my project, and straining my MacBook. The RAM consumption is easily explainable, though; I am working on a very large, complex project, and VSCode must keep all of the symbols in memory, all at once.) If I should have filed it there instead, please notify me or just migrate the issue. Thanks!

data.title: Extensions Details and Changelog views scroll bar broken after Zoom In/Out
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (64801727521592cf5fe64fd911b1efe41b1ea732, 2017-02-20T07:13:27.765Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code (does not matter if its window is maximized or non-maximized)
2. Open Extensions > Popular Extensions
3. Open a random extension
4. Press Ctrl + = (Zoom In)
5. The 'Details' and 'Changelog' views's scroll bars are not properly positioned (far right and bottom of the window)
6. The opposite disposition appears also on 'Zoom Out'
7. The same problem happens on those non-zero zoom levels with some extension's views. For example: 'Annotator'

data.title: Colon in | text block
data.body:
I have yaml files with texts.
Texts can be multiline, include markdown. I screen out the texts with `|` thing.
```
En: |
  Some text: continuation of the text. 
```
In this case `Some text` is colorized as a key. But actually due to `|` it is going to be parsed as part of the text.

Yaml2json converter, for example, interpretes this syntax as expected:
```
{
  "En": "Some text: continuation of the text. \n"
}
```

But yaml colorizer mistakenly takes `:` in this case as key/value delimiter.

data.title: Minimap: can only click outside of current 'view'
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file of decent length
2. Use the minimap to scroll somewhere:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3329959/23141352/6f7faade-f784-11e6-8d2d-7f99db1f2829.png)

3. Try to fine-tune your view by clicking a bit lower in the minimap, but still inside the view pane box:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3329959/23141355/766c38b2-f784-11e6-9695-2f6c226a7656.png)

### Expected result

* The editor should scroll a bit to match the newest click

### Actual result

* Nothing happens

data.title: [html] Add symbol support for HTML files
data.body:
WebStorm provides ["File Structure Popup"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Ai8966qny0&feature=youtu.be&t=39) support for HTML files. The closest vscode analog is file symbols (ctrl+shift+O) which is not currently supported for HTML files.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2957173/23140975/c2e00306-f7b4-11e6-8ac9-b24f265aec23.png)

The vscode-html-language-service needs only a small change to support this. I have opened an [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-html-languageservice/issues/8) there as well as a [pull request](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-html-languageservice/pull/7) to show how it can be added, but it would also require a change here to begin consuming the language service change.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2957173/23141168/c7f47e0c-f7b5-11e6-8104-42cbc76cf09f.png)

data.title: newline issues in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.12|
|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.53|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|java|redhat|0.0.10|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.4.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|
|vscode-proto3|zxh404|0.1.0|

---

**Observed behavior (1):**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy a line with no newlines, but that wraps (because of screen width) from the integrated terminal and paste back into the terminal
2.  The pasted line will now have newlines.


**Observed behavior (2)**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start to type a line at a prompt in the terminal
2. Paste additional text whose length should cause the line to wrap
3. The pasted line is garbled on a single line with no wrapping

data.title: Faster and/or consistent mouse scrolling
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|

---

Is there a setting that allows for faster scrolling? That is, more lines scrolled per notch of the mouse wheel. If not, I'd like to request it. My OS setting in Mouse Properties is to scroll 6 number of lines which appears to not be reflected in VSCode.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with more lines than can be shown on the screen.
2. Scroll one notch with the mouse wheel. On my system the view scrolls about 2.5 lines.

data.title: Emmet Update Tag does not work with JSX, but works file with HTML
data.body:
From @caiolopes in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4962#issuecomment-279769034

The feature "updateTag" is not working when language mode is JavaScript React, only HTML.. And it is so useful for adding a class, etc, in an already existing component.

data.title: Peek definition works like Go to Definition if it runing from command palette
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place cursor on a simbol
2. Open command palette and choose Peek Definition
3. Repeat this several times.

Instead of showing a Peek Definition window, the editor opens a file with a definition. It happens in about 50% of cases.
